metadata.title: Iraq Signs Agreement with US Energy Giant Chevron on Oil Exploration

left: Iraq signed a principles agreement with Chevron to develop oil fields, including al-Nasiriya and Balad, marking the US firm's return after years away.
The agreement includes the al-Nasiriya project and the development of the Balad oil field.
Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani stated that the government adopted a new approach to engage with major international oil companies, particularly U.S. firms.
Chevron Vice President Frank Mount emphasized that Iraq offers major opportunities in resources and workforce capacity, supporting a long-term partnership with Chevron.
center: Iraq signed an agreement with US energy giant Chevron on oil exploration, welcoming the company back to the country.
The agreement allows Chevron to assess potential opportunities in Iraq and establish exclusive negotiations between the two.
Chevron's Vice President Frank Mount expressed confidence in the company's ability to support Iraq in developing new energy resources.
right: Iraq signed an agreement with US energy giant Chevron on oil exploration, welcoming the company back to the country.
The agreement allows Chevron to assess potential opportunities in Iraq and establish exclusive negotiations between the two.
Chevron's Vice President Frank Mount expressed confidence in the company's ability to support Iraq in developing new energy resources.
